info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 09 at 2:07PM MDT until August 09 at 3:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE BEAR TRAP BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR WEST CENTRAL SOCORRO COUNTY... At 207 PM MDT, While the heaviest rainfall is coming to an end over the Bear Trap Burn Scar, excessive runoff and possible flash flooding will continue to be a threat through the mid afternoon. Between 0.75 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall from earlier thunderstorms over the burn scar will impact Big Pigeon Canyon, Little Pigeon Canyon, Whitewater Canyon, and West Red Canyon downstream to Alamosa Creek and State Road 52. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Thunderstorms producing heavy rain and possible flash flooding over the Bear Trap Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Excessive runoff and potentially life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Bear Trap Burn Scar. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Dusty. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated water levels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of the Bear Trap wildfire burn area. Do not camp along streams and rivers. Remain alert when hiking in steep, narrow canyons. Know where you are relative to low spots and drainages.
